page.title: 01OUR AREA
page.content: Our area is in countryside which is fairly typical of Lincolnshire as a county. Most of the land around us is flat, and is therefore ideal for farming. The main type of farming which occurs in our area is arable. Many different crops are grown, ranging from barley to sugar beet. Because the land is flat the area is also highly suitable for use as an air field. Our area contains a large part of R.A.F. Cranwell, which is a Royal Air Force base used to train future officers and pilots. The village of Cranwell is also included in our area, it is a moderately sized village, with both modern and older housing.
